GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/users.description: serves an object with a key of 'total' that represents all retrieved users as an integer, and 'users' that represents all user objects in an array. Can take a query of 'sort_by' to determine how to arrange 'users' - valid sort_bys are 'join_date'(default) and 'username'. Can also take a query of 'order' to determine if the 'sort_by' is ascending or descending - valid orders are 'desc'(default) and 'asc'

GET /api/users/:user_id.description: serves an the requested user as an object on the key of 'user'

POST /api/users.description: posts a new user and serves that user as an object on the key of 'user'. Takes 3 mandatory properties of 'username', 'email' and 'password'

POST /api/users/login.description: Takes 2 mandatory properties of 'username' and 'password', and serves a message either to authorise or deny a login attempt based on the provided password matching the provided user's password

PATCH /api/users/:user_id.description: updates the selected user via 'user_id' and serves the updated user as an object. Takes at least one property from 'username', 'email', 'password' and 'avatar_url'

DELETE /api/users/:user_id.description: deletes the selected user via 'user_id'. deleting a user will cascade down and delete any children in other data tables (eg. 'leagues')

GET /api/leagues.description: serves an object with a key of 'total' that represents all retrieved leagues as an integer, and 'leagues' that represents all league objects in an array

GET /api/leagues/:league_id.description: serves an the requested league as an object on the key of 'league'
